block.p: NYUonline, New York, a for-profit unit of New York University where students can take courses online, to Toolbox Inc., New York, to handle its first account. Billings were estimated at $10 million to $12 million.

Bombardier, Valcourt, Quebec, to the Cossette Communications Group, Montreal, and Cramer-Krasselt, Milwaukee, to handle Ski-Doo skimobiles, which had been with Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide, Dearborn, Mich., part of the WPP Group. Billings were estimated at $10 million.

NYUonline, New York, a for-profit unit of New York University where students can take courses online, to Toolbox Inc., New York, to handle its first account. Billings were estimated at $10 million to $12 million.

Bombardier, Valcourt, Quebec, to the Cossette Communications Group, Montreal, and Cramer-Krasselt, Milwaukee, to handle Ski-Doo skimobiles, which had been with Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide, Dearborn, Mich., part of the WPP Group. Billings were estimated at $10 million.

Wesley Jessen Visioncare, Des Plaines, Ill., to Publicis & Hal Riney, Chicago, part of Publicis S.A., to handle the account of the contact lens maker, which had been at Crowley Webb & Associates, Buffalo. Billings were estimated at $10 million.

Experience.com, Boston, a Web site that assists college students and alumni looking for jobs, to CGN Marketing and Creative Services, Boston, part of Epsilon Data Management, and the Renegade Marketing Group, New York, an affiliate of Dentsu USA, to handle its first account. Spending was estimated at $7 million to $10 million.

Tri-Valley Growers, San Ramon, Calif., to Grant, Scott & Hurley, San Francisco, to handle the S&W and Libby's brands of canned foods, an account that had been inactive. Billings were estimated at $5 million.

The Pinehurst Co., Pinehurst, N.C., a unit ofClubCorp that owns golf resorts, to the Richards Group, Dallas, to handle its first consolidated account. Billings were estimated at $3 million to $5 million.
